Detailed Description

Access to the DAE residual function.

Function Documentation

int jmi_dae_get_sizes ( jmi_t *  jmi,
int *  n_eq_F 
)

Get the number of equations of the DAE.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
n_eq_F (Output) The number of DAE equations is stored in this argument.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_dae_F ( jmi_t *  jmi,
jmi_real_t *  res 
)

Evaluate DAE residual.

The user sets the input variables by writing to the vectors obtained from the functions jmi_get_dx, jmi_get_x etc.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
res (Output) The DAE residual vector.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_dae_dF ( jmi_t *  jmi,
int  eval_alg,
int  sparsity,
int  independent_vars,
int *  mask,
jmi_real_t *  jac 
)

Evaluate the Jacobian of the DAE residual function.

The user sets the input variables by writing to the vectors obtained from the functions jmi_get_dx, jmi_get_x etc.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
eval_alg Set to either JMI_DER_SYMBOLIC to evaluate a symbolic Jacobian or JMI_DER_CPPAD to evaluate the Jacobian by means of CppAD.
sparsity Set to JMI_DER_SPARSE, JMI_DER_DENSE_COL_MAJOR, or JMI_DER_DENS_ROW_MAJOR to indicate the output format of the Jacobian.
independent_vars Used to indicate which columns of the full Jacobian should be evaluated. The constants JMI_DER_DX, JMI_DER_X etc are used to set this argument.
mask This argument is a vector containing ones for the Jacobian columns that should be included in the Jacobian and zeros for those which should not.
jac (Output) The Jacobian.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_dae_dF_n_nz ( jmi_t *  jmi,
int  eval_alg,
int *  n_nz 
)

Returns the number of non-zeros in the full DAE residual Jacobian.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
eval_alg Indicates which for which Jacobian the number of non-zero elements should be returned: Symbolic (JMI_DER_SYMBOLIC) or CppAD (JMI_DER_CPPAD).
n_nz (Output) The number of non-zero Jacobian entries.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_dae_dF_nz_indices ( jmi_t *  jmi,
int  eval_alg,
int  independent_vars,
int *  mask,
int *  row,
int *  col 
)

Returns the row and column indices of the non-zero elements in the DAE residual Jacobian.

Notice that Fortran style indexing is used: the first row (and column) has index 1.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
eval_alg See jmi_dae_dF.
independent_vars See jmi_dae_dF.
mask See jmi_dae_dF.
row (Output) The row indices of the non-zeros in the DAE residual Jacobian.
col (Output) The column indices of the non-zeros in the DAE residual Jacobian.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_dae_dF_dim ( jmi_t *  jmi,
int  eval_alg,
int  sparsity,
int  independent_vars,
int *  mask,
int *  dF_n_cols,
int *  dF_n_nz 
)

This helper function computes the number of columns and the number of non zero elements in the Jacobian of the DAE residual given a sparsity configuration.

Parameters:
jmi A jmi_t struct.
eval_alg See jmi_dae_dF.
sparsity See jmi_dae_dF.
independent_vars See jmi_dae_dF.
mask See jmi_dae_dF.
dF_n_cols (Output) The number of columns of the resulting Jacobian.
dF_n_nz (Output) The number of non-zeros of the resulting Jacobian.
